purpose: The commit modifies the hci_cmd_sync_queue function in the net/bluetooth/hci_sync.c file to return an error if HCI_UNREGISTER flag has been set, preventing a use-after-free (UAF) after the timeout as the hdev will be freed.

The commit removes an unnecessary include of 'asm/termios.h' from 'drivers/tty/n_hdlc.c', as it is already included by 'linux/tty.h'. The author explains that this simplifies the situation with 'termios.h' and reduces complexity.
The commit updates documentation for a new metric 'N/A' in the perf-c2c tool, reflecting changes in the report table for store operations.

This commit addresses two issues related to vma lock handling during split vma and range unmapping in the Linux kernel's hugepage memory management system (hugetlb). It also includes changes to prevent double freeing of structures and ensure that a vma lock is present for all VM_MAYSHARE vmas. The commit also addresses issues around vma splitting.
The commit adds AVDD and MICVDD supplies to the realtek,rt5682s binding file in the sound devicetree bindings.
The commit fixes a resource leak in the zorro7xx_remove_one() function of the scsi driver for Zorro7xx devices by adding an iounmap() call to undo an ioremap() that was not being freed.
The commit removes an unused work field from struct mlx5e_async_ctx in kTLS_tx.c file.
The commit modifies the struct cfg80211_auth_request in net/cfg80211.h to make key_idx signed. This change is intended to avoid warnings from static checkers such as smatch when key is NULL.
The commit sorts the order of CONFIG_SURFACE_PLATFORMS in two configuration files for RISC-V architecture.

The commit introduces a new function mcp251xfd_is_fd_mode() and replaces some hardcoded checks in the codebase with calls to this function. The purpose of the commit is to make the code more modular and easier to maintain by abstracting away the check for whether the chip's FIFOs are configured for CAN-FD mode.
The commit modifies the selftests for RTC to skip when RTC is not present.
The commit removes a redundant assignment to the variable 'bytes' in the file 'sound/pci/echoaudio/midi.c', which cleans up a clang scan build warning.
The commit allows rcuscale to work without RCU Tasks, reducing kernel size and complexity of certain tracing operations.
The commit removes a duplicate phrase from a header file used in the KVM x86 MMU.

The commit reverts a change made to the dcn315_clk_mgr.c file in the Linux kernel's AMD GPU driver. The change involved populating a clock table based on dcfclk, but due to how pmfw fills out the table when dcfclk states are disabled, using dcfclk based clk table would cause a no read situation. The commit reverts this change to prevent underflow until a better solution is coded.
The commit adds a compatible string for the Renesas RZ/V2L SoC (R9A07G054) with a Bifrost Mali-G31 GPU to the device tree bindings.
The commit renames the struct pcie_port to dw_pcie_rp in multiple files across the driver for consistency.

The commit modifies a line of code in the xgbe-drv.c file to fix a Clang warning about format specification type mismatch. The change involves replacing '%#06hx' with '%#06x'. The commit also includes explanations and references to relevant documentation.
The commit modifies a range check in the MIPS jump_label function to avoid a warning by casting the upper bound of the branch range to long for signed comparison.

The commit removes a case from SetHwReg8188EU() function in rtw_p2p.c file and replaces it with a call to a new function rtl8188e_set_p2p_ps_offload_cmd(). The purpose of the commit is to get rid of the unwanted hal layer.
The commit declares non-global symbols as static in the arm64/kernel/cpu_errata.c file to fix sparse warnings introduced while adding errata.
The commit modifies the device tree bindings for MSM8998 and QCM2290 display subsystems to remove incorrect interrupt flags on MDSS nodes.

The commit modifies the v4l2-ctrls API and core files to allow changing the array size of control structures from a driver. It also adds a new function req_alloc_array() and updates existing functions to use it.
The commit adds support for new PMICs and SoCs to the socinfo driver.
The commit modifies the rtl8xxxu_core.c file to recognize all possible chip cuts (A-P) in the RTL8xxxU wireless driver for Realtek chips, instead of printing 'unknown' when it's greater than E.
The commit removes a custom software enable count from the PRCMU clocks driver for the ux500 chipset. The core already keeps a software enable count, so this custom count is no longer needed.

The commit removes unnecessary #ifdef CONFIG_XIP_KERNEL usage in arch/riscv/mm/init.c file by moving the pt_ops macro to adjacent #ifdef CONFIG_XIP_KERNEL and grouping first type usage cases into one.
The commit enables QUP and GPI DMA hardware to add functioning I2C nodes later.
The commit modifies comments and corrects a typo in the thermal driver for RZG2L, improving readability and adhering to coding style.

The commit fixes an infinite loop issue in the release_swfw_sync function of igc_i225.c file for Intel IGC drivers. If the hardware is surprise-removed, an infinite loop may occur due to failure to acquire the HW semaphore needed for resource release. The commit adds a check to log an error and quit if the semaphore cannot be acquired.
The commit updates the pcm3168a driver to use more modern terminology for clocking. It modifies the code to replace 'master_mode' with 'provider_mode' in several places.
The commit removes unnecessary code from the NFS file.c file, specifically a hack for future NFS swap support that is no longer needed as IS_SWAPFILE is always defined.

The commit adds support for handling GTP Echo Request messages by implementing a new function gtp0_send_echo_resp() that sends an Echo Response message when a GTP Echo Request is received. It also includes changes to the gtp.c and gtp.h files to define new structures, constants, and functions related to this feature.

The commit replaces instances of 'cpumask_next_*' with 'cpumask_first_*' functions in various files across the Linux kernel. It also adds a new function 'cpumask_first_zero()'. The purpose is to improve the effectiveness and consistency of the code related to CPU mask operations.

The commit removes a call to 'dtim_assoc' IOVAR from the brcmfmac:cfg80211.c file in the wireless driver for Broadcom devices. This is done because the firmware no longer supports getting TIM information from it, causing a failure that results in a console message when roaming is complete.
The commit adds support for a new platform 'adl_rt5682' without amplifier for alc5682 headset codec. It connects alc5682 to SSP0 following Intel BT offload design.
The commit modifies the io_uring/net.c file to fail zerocopy sendmsg when unsupported by socket.

The commit modifies a LaTeX style file used for generating documentation in the Linux kernel to test for the existence of a specific package (xeCJK) before loading it. This is done to prevent errors on certain distributions where this package does not work correctly due to a missing dependency.
The commit modifies a script used for checking the Linux kernel code to allow the use of 'case' macros without triggering an error message.

The commit replaces simple-KMS helpers with regular atomic helpers in the simpledrm driver for the Linux kernel's DRM subsystem. This change improves code sharing among drivers and does not affect functional behavior.

The commit adds a new jpeg decode worker interface to ensure that three hardware components run in parallel on MT8195. It includes the addition of several functions and variables related to managing the hardware workers, such as getting and putting hardware, setting hardware parameters, and a worker function. The commit also modifies the existing device_run function to handle both jpeg encoding and decoding.

The commit removes unnecessary VPRINTK() calls and ata_scsi_dump_cdb() function from various files related to ATA (Advanced Technology Attachment) drivers in the Linux kernel. This change aims to reduce redundant logging and improve performance.

The commit adds support for zstate during extended vblank in the drm/amd/display driver. This allows entering zstate if the time gained from extra vblank lines is greater than 5 ms when entering freesync.

The commit modifies the function pointer prototype of hqd_destroy() callback in kgd_kfd_interface.h to match the actual type of its third parameter (reset_type) from 'enum kfd_preempt_type' to 'uint32_t'. This is done to fix a Control Flow Integrity (CFI) failure that occurs when booting a kernel compiled with CONFIG_CFI_CLANG on a machine with an RX 6700 XT.
The commit corrects a typo in the 'resets' property name for the reset binding in the stm32-pinctrl.yaml file.
The commit modifies the Makefile for the ath9k driver to silence a GCC 12 warning about array bounds on the 'ath9k_hw_resettxqueue' function in mac.c file.
The commit modifies a driver file to use pm_runtime_resume_and_get instead of pm_runtime_get_sync for power management. The change is intended to simplify the code.

The commit modifies the io_uring/filetable.c, io_uring/filetable.h, io_uring/openclose.c, io_uring/openclose.h, and io_uring/rsrc.c files to change how fixed files are installed and removed in the io_uring subsystem. It moves the code related to this functionality from io_kiocb to io_ring_ctx, and adjusts the corresponding APIs accordingly.

The commit modifies the device tree bindings for the nxp,imx8mq-vpu media driver to support separate nodes for G1 and G2 decoders with vpu-blk-ctrl power-domain support. The new configuration is not supported.
The commit removes a macro definition 'IWL_DEVICE_BZ_COMMON' from the code and replaces it with 'IWL_DEVICE_BZ'. This change seems to be related to device configuration for Intel Wi-Fi.
